0.user_question: Ocean sunfish: species of fish. Would it be impossible to keep an ocean sunfish and a goldfish in the same tank?

ost_step.1: Ocean sunfish, also known as mola mola, are large, flat, warm-water fish species found in various temperate and tropical oceans around the world. They can grow up to 14 feet (4.3 meters) long and weigh up to 5,000 pounds (2,300 kilograms).
ost_step.2: Goldfish are common freshwater fish, typically kept as pets in home aquariums. They usually grow up to about 12 inches (30 cm) long and weigh around 10 pounds (4.5 kg).
ost_step.3: Ocean sunfish and goldfish have significantly different habitat requirements and conditions needed to thrive. Ocean sunfish require large bodies of open water, high temperatures, and access to sunlight, while goldfish adapt well to various temperatures and are typically kept in smaller containers filled with fresh water.

direct_answer.text: Based on the information provided, it would indeed be impossible to keep an ocean sunfish and a goldfish in the same tank due to their vastly different environmental needs and conditions. Ocean sunfish need large volumes of open water, high temperatures, and access to sunlight, which cannot be met within a typical home aquarium setting. Meanwhile, goldfish are adapted to living in smaller bodies of fresh water. Attempting to house these two species together would lead to the detriment of both animals. The answer is: true.
